main_title: Investing 10B VND in Vietnam Under a Tariff-Driven Global Regime

outline.summary: Cover slide with title, subtitle, presenter, date, and a Vietnam-themed background image.
content_outline: Title, subtitle contextualizing tariffs and Vietnam
Presenter name and date
Striking background image of Vietnam skyline

outline.summary: Clarify horizon, risk tolerance, liquidity, currency, and objectives.
content_outline: Horizon 3–5 years; medium risk
Liquidity: keep 12 months expenses; maintain near-cash
Currency: mix of VND and USD exposures
Objective: preserve and grow VND purchasing power

outline.summary: Frame three tariff scenarios and high-level impacts.
content_outline: Scenario A: Broad base tariff + higher China-specific rates
Scenario B: Targeted sector tariffs; anti-circumvention focus
Scenario C: Limited changes; negotiation-led gradualism
Implications for USD, growth, and Vietnam trade/FDI

outline.summary: Growth, inflation, policy stance with reputable references.
content_outline: ADB ADO Apr 2025: GDP ~6.6% (2025), inflation ~4.0%
World Bank overview updated May 9, 2025
SBV balancing growth support with FX stability
Takeaway: constructive medium-term with external risks

outline.summary: Explain the channels from tariffs to a Vietnam investor’s portfolio.
content_outline: Demand/margins: export sectors
USD strength and tighter financial conditions
Supply-chain relocation to Vietnam (China+1)
Commodities and inflation pass-through
Policy responses at home and abroad

outline.summary: Positioning across Vietnam sectors with quality and resilience.
content_outline: Banks: quality balance sheets and fee income
Consumer staples and utilities: defensiveness
Industrials/logistics: FDI and infrastructure buildout
Selective tech/services; export exposure with pricing power

outline.summary: Roles of VND fixed income, USD assets, and gold in this regime.
content_outline: Short-duration VND bonds/deposits as ballast
USD sleeve via T-bills and small global equity
Gold as convex hedge; SJC vs international pricing
Implementation tips & access

outline.summary: Proposed base allocation for 10B VND with rationale.
content_outline: Liquidity & near-cash: 20%
VND bonds/treasuries: 25%
USD assets: 20% (mostly T-bills + 5–7% global equity)
Vietnam equities: 35% diversified
Gold: 10%

outline.summary: Alternative allocations with expected return and drawdown bands.
content_outline: Defensive: more bonds/cash; less equities; 10% gold
Aggressive: more equities; smaller USD/bond sleeves
Expected return bands and drawdown ranges
When to tilt between them

outline.summary: How to enter, maintain, and adjust the portfolio.
content_outline: DCA over 3–6 months, 4–6 tranches
Rebalancing bands: +/-20% deviation within sleeves
Risk limits: cash ≥15%; USD 15–25%; single name <5%
Triggers to go defensive/aggressive

outline.summary: Closing slide with key takeaway and contact line.
content_outline: One-line takeaway: balance growth with hedges
